name: provisionally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is true for the present time but could change: Club members have provisionally agreed to the changes. His novel has been provisionally accepted for publication. See
provisional
More examplesFewer examplesShe spent three years as a provisionally licensed teacher.The planning permission was approved provisionally in March this year. I've provisionally arranged a meeting for tomorrow.
